intro: Chaetogastra rojasii, commonly known as the Rojas' hairplant, is a rare and unique species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, hair-like structures that cover its thallus, giving it a distinctive appearance. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures are specialized, with archegonia and antheridia playing key roles in its sexual reproduction. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Chaetogastra rojasii is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
